intro: Ptilagrostis concinna subsp. schischkinii, commonly known as the Schischkin's feathergrass, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of steppe and desert ecosystems.
